pageContext.claim: “'The questions are an intrusion into the President’s Article 2  powers under the Constitution to fire any Executive Branch Employee...what the President was thinking is an outrageous.....as to the President’s unfettered power to fire anyone...' Joe Digenova, former US Attorney”
pageContext.analysis: This is a reference to the list of questions written by Trump's lawyers after a meeting with investigators from the special counsel's office in March 2018. Determining motive ("what the president was thinking," in this case) is a key part of any criminal investigation. Article II does not explicitly bar prosecutors from asking questions of the president, and no court has reached this conclusion.
